extendedIngredients.name: canned diced tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: canned pinto beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (15 ounces each) pinto beans, rinsed and drained

recipes.title: Three-Meat Chili

winePairing.pairingText: Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz are my top picks for Chili. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. One wine you could try is Poema Brut Cava. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: Poema Brut Cava
productMatches.description: Vibrant aromas of ripe peaches, pears and toasted bread with a hint of spice fill the nose. The palate is dry with a rich, creamy texture. Layers of flavor include orange rind and spice that persists through an elegant finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a Dutch oven or soup kettle, cook the pork, onion and green pepper in oil over medium heat until meat is no longer pink.                                                                                           Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook turkey and beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. Drain pork mixture; add turkey and beef.                                                                                           Stir in the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour or until flavors are blended.                                        Yield: 12 servings (3 quarts).                                                                                                                         Originally published as Three-Meat Chili in  CountryOctober/November 2006, p51                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 cup) equals 359 calories, 16 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 80 mg cholesterol, 675 mg sodium, 25 g carbohydrate, 7 g fiber, 30 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a Dutch oven or soup kettle, cook the pork, onion and green pepper in oil over medium heat until meat is no longer pink.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook turkey and beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Drain pork mixture; add turkey and beef.
Stir in the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour or until flavors are blended.
